In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(lowercase(text)), " ")
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed et libero nunc. Nullam id tellus nec massa facilisis volutpat. Integer ullamcorper justo nec fermentum congue."""
output = wrap_string(text)
println(output)
```
This example will wrap the long text into multiple lines with a maximum `text_width` of 10 characters.
